Fields.DialogueText: What is it, Cap'n?
There's a sign on my door with "Don't Open" scrawled haphazardly on it.
All right, this must be a trick.
Maybe it was done at the last minute?

Fields.MenuText: There'd better not be a bucket hanging anywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't work on inward-swinging doors. Trust me, I've tried it!

Fields.MenuText: If there's another popgun tied to the door, I'm going to have a heart attack.

Fields.DialogueText: Loads of live rounds flying about and you don't bat an eye. A single popgun rigged on a door, and everyone loses their minds!

Fields.MenuText: I hope there isn't glue on the handle.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, no, I've stopped doin' that. Lenny told me not to. Difficult to get unstuck.
All right, I'm going in.
... Huh. Nothing happened.
See? Nothin' to worry about!
*ALARM*
Just as I get in...
Ow! Why did you kick me?
Just helpin' ya get a move on, is all!
Belles...
@BATTLE
I think she was over on the port side. Why?
Every time I pass her she boots me right in the butt and comes up with some excuse for it.
Anyone seen Manchester?
Well, that is what the sign says.
What sign?
There on your back. "Kick Me."
Eh? Manchester!
You called?

Fields.MenuText: Does this sign look familiar to you?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I've seen it on your back, if that's what you mean!

Fields.MenuText: Are you looking to get kicked, Manchester?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't have a sign on me, do I?

Fields.MenuText: Did you put this on me earlier?

Fields.DialogueText: Define "put on me" and "earlier."
Is that what the whole thing was about?
... Maybe.
Ugh. At least I managed to figure it out before too long.
It was hilarious while it lasted!
*ALARM*
How about you try kicking some Morganas instead?
They could use a few signs, too!
@BATTLE
Captain, Morganas incoming!
Everyone to stations!
@BATTLE
Good job, everyone. Now--
Pfft.
Excuse me?
You should look in a mirror, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Do I even want to know?
Please tell me she didn't put another sign on me.
If she touched my hair, I will use that bat of hers to clean the guns.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, it's not that bad.
Not this time, no!
You keep your hands away from my bat!
All I did was put some paint on your binoculars so you'd turn into a raccoon when you looked through them.
... I'm going to wash this off now and make sure everything's bolted down.
You're no fun.
Nothing in my chair. That's good. Nothing in my bunk either. Now to check the desk...
I'm checking for any more pranks you might have set up for me. You seem to be doing them more often.
Cuz I'm bored. Other than the occasional battle, I've nothin' to do.
What're ya doin', Cap'n?

Fields.MenuText: Why not read Engels or your pulps?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I have! Several times. But I've practically memorised those!

Fields.MenuText: Football not doing it for you?

Fields.DialogueText: The lads haven't exactly forgiven me for that dirty tackle on O'Brien last time.

Fields.MenuText: Surely you could prank others.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I do! I prank everyone!
... Say, I've an idea!
Colour me morbidly curious.
*ALARM*
I'll tell ya after we win this battle!
Take all the time you need.
@BATTLE
Teach you how to pull off some pranks!
You want to do what?

Fields.MenuText: Does this mean I get to finally get you back for the fish in last week's reports?

Fields.DialogueText: You can try, but I've never been pranked myself!

Fields.MenuText: What use would that be?

Fields.DialogueText: Pranking requires a lot of brainpower, and you're loaded with it! Not to mention the strategic value it provides...

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure this isn't another prank?

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't be that mean! Besides, I take pranking deadly seriously.
... All right, I'm in.
Really?
If it keeps you from pranking me for a while. I might even learn something with applications in battle.
Great! Shall we make a lesson out of this?
*ALARM*
More shells, fewer banana peels.
@BATTLE
Right! Hey, Morganas! Think fast!
Don't spoil the surprise.
Spoil, nothin'! It's better if they see you rollin' your sleeves up!
Welcome to Learning to Prank with Manchester! With me: Manchester!

Fields.MenuText: Come up with that name all by yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: Yep! Any other questions?

Fields.MenuText: Planning on marketing it?

Fields.DialogueText: Spoken like a capitalist! I just wanted a catchy name.

Fields.MenuText: Is it too late to back out?

Fields.DialogueText: You bet it is! Now listen up!
I hope I don't regret this.
Lesson on! Always go after people who are unaware of their surroundings!
They're usually the easiest targets.
A sneak attack, in other words.
Exactly!
Then why are you against actual sneak attacks?
Pranks are one thing. Battles are another! I prefer to get stuck right in rather than sneaking around.
*ALARM*
And here comes something to get stuck into!
@BATTLE
Lesson two! Always have a backup plan! Sometimes the target won't do what you want, so you have to improvise!
Example.
I tried to do the classic bucket prank the other day, but went with a whoopee cushion in the end.
Now, I'm pretty sure he knew he was a target, so he made sure he wasn't out of his office long enough for an ice bucket.
But he forgot about my Belle powers! I ghosted right into his quarters and snuck the cushion under just as he sat down.

Fields.MenuText: Why didn't you just use your Belle powers to do the bucket?
Just a whoopee cushion?
Have you had to do that with anyone else?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, well, ya see... hmm. Good point! I'll remember that.
Sometimes the simplest prank is the best one!
You wouldn't believe how slippery the Lieutenant is!
Well, so far this seems pretty elementary. Choose unsuspecting targets and have backup plans.
We'll see, Cap'n. It's time to test what you've learned so far!
*ALARM*
I don't think during a battle is the best time.
Er... right! I'd never do that. Certainly never done that before...
Manchester...
Uh... Look! Morganas!
@BATTLE
Right, let's start you off with an easy one.
Define "easy."
You're gonna take this tack and put it on O'Brien's seat at the radio.

Fields.MenuText: I thought this prank was supposed to be harmless.
And a tack is better than a whoopee cushion because...?
What did O'Brien ever do to me?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, he'll be fine! It's just a small prick in the arse.
Because you can hide a tack better!
Lesson one! He's away from his station getting coffee. Now's your chance!
... He may have also beaten me at a penalty shootout.
Are you seriously using me for a petty grudge?
Just put the tack down and wait, all right?
All right, fine.
Done.
And right on time. We've got company!
@BATTLE
Now we just wait and--
Ow! What the--? Who the blazes put a tack there?
Bingo! Come on, let's go!
I am not going to become your pranking minion.
'Course not! How about "partner in crime?"
You bet! I thought it was a good idea to start with something you'd have to try to screw up.
Well, that seemed to go right to plan.

Fields.MenuText: What's that supposed to mean?

Fields.DialogueText: My first time, I tried to put the tack the other way round. Nowhere near the intended effect!

Fields.MenuText: Next time I think I'm going with the cushion. Less pain, more childish entertainment.

Fields.DialogueText: Just keep that option open for quick and easy revenge!

Fields.MenuText: I do hope this is the last of my involvement between you and O'Brien.

Fields.DialogueText: No worries! I've other plans for him. At least it killed two birds with one stone!
So what's next on the curriculum?
We try some more classics and see how you go!
Can I at least try the bucket one on someone other than Lenny?
Well...
*ALARM*
Hmm... I wonder if there are any pranks that work on Morganas?
I prefer those that put giant holes in them.
@BATTLE
Well, that's that. Passed your checkup with flying colours, Captain.
Thanks, Lenny. Put 'er there.
Ow! What was that?
Manchester had one of these joy buzzers lying around. I thought I'd give it a go.
Oof. It gave me a go all right.
Ha! Should've seen the look on his face!

Fields.MenuText: I always thought those had a stronger shock to them.
Are you sure I can't keep this one? You have at least three.
That was quite a shocking experience for him.

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't actually shock someone! It's got this spring that unwinds and makes it feel that way.
Absolutely not! That one happens to be my favourite. One of the Americans brought it all the way from Philadelphia!
Not as bad as an Ark pun, but you made the effort.
So how did I do?
Pretty good for your first time. You just need to work on the followup!
Like the punchline?
More the delivery. Give a grin! Show it off! Bolt away like someone lit a fire under ya!
*ALARM*
Let's light a fire under these Morganas, shall we?
That's the spirit!
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap'n, ya get my list?
List of what?
Necessities! I put it on your desk.

Fields.MenuText: I hesitate to ask what they're for...

Fields.DialogueText: Hesitate no longer!

Fields.MenuText: I thought we only just got some more pulps on board.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yeah! The last few were a bit mingin', but the latest ones look a lot better!

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell me you've gone through the Johnnie Walker already...

Fields.DialogueText: It's not my fault it tastes great!
I've put together a list of items that will be useful for pranks and general troublemaking!
I suppose this is also part of my training?
Of course! Oh, you might want to be careful. I might have spilled some invisible ink on it.
How am I supposed to clean that up?
*ALARM*
You can figure it out. I've got Morganas to beat on!
@BATTLE
All in due time, Captain! All in due time...
What are you planning?
Three coolers of mackerel, seven buckets, two large spools of string, a crate of whoopee cushions...

Fields.MenuText: What on earth do you need all that mackerel for?
And a partridge in a pear tree?

Fields.DialogueText: No, but that gives me an idea!

Fields.MenuText: ... And two additional bottles of Johnnie Walker, presumably to replace those you drank.

Fields.DialogueText: No idea what you're on about!
Well... I've always just gone after specific individuals one at a time. Now that you're doin' this with me...
You're in need of a pranking minion to up your game.
Well, when you put it like that... yeah!
I need hardly remind you that I'm your captain.
Give it a think over!
*ALARM*
Hard to think with that alarm going off.
No problem! I'll sink those Morganas real quick-like for your creativity!
That too.
@BATTLE
Well? Given it a thought?
I have.
And?
And--
*ALARM*
And we should deal with the Morganas first.
Fine time for it!
@BATTLE
Phew! Now, you were saying?

Fields.MenuText: Just don't refer to me as your "minion."

Fields.DialogueText: Right. I'll join you.
Yes! Oh, we are gonna be so mint!
Aww, but it's such a cute nickname!

Fields.MenuText: Mint? Like, minty fresh?

Fields.DialogueText: Nah, mint like money! It means "very good!"

Fields.MenuText: So what are we to do first, great lady of prank?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, lady-ish.
First things first: a look at my schematics. Meet me in your cabin...
So as you can see, if we place the buckets here, here, and here, we can maximise splash radius.
I don't think I've ever seen you so... organised. And you're planning things out, not barreling in headfirst.
All condiments come in bottles that are easily painted over and their insides replaced.
And there's a small spot by the engines where we can hide some mackerel. Nobody will find it there!
Any questions?
Eh? I am the real Manchester! I just prefer plannin' pranks and games to attacks!

Fields.MenuText: Who are you and what have you done with the real Manchester?
What about the cushions?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, those are just to restock with. They break easy, ya know!

Fields.MenuText: Is all this really necessary?

Fields.DialogueText: 'Course it is! I made charts to prove it.
What can I say? Now, we get a shift on, we can get these done by the end of the day. You take the mess!
*ALARM*
After we deal with the Morganas?
After we deal with the Morganas!
@BATTLE
And?
The mustard and ketchup have been swapped, as have the salt and sugar.
Well, I did as I was asked.
You've been doing well, Cap'n! I'm a bit surprised at how you've handled yourself, actually.

Fields.MenuText: Got to be adaptable in this day and age.

Fields.DialogueText: You're a regular chameleon!

Fields.MenuText: I certainly have learned quite a few useful tricks for on and off the battlefield.

Fields.DialogueText: See? I knew ya'd get somethin' out of it!

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I'm just glad to be the one pulling the pranks for once.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't think you're exempt when this is all done! I'm an opportunistic striker!
So how long until it all kicks off?
Usually not long. Give it a few minutes for lunch to roll around.
And to make sure not to be a victim of the pranks myself?
You got it! You may want to get a head start, though.
Why is that?
Cuz I've spotted a Morgana, and the gun crews get hungry after a fight!
@BATTLE
Captain, we need to talk.
Of course. About what?
The crew got into it with the cooks because the condiments had been swapped.
I've had two sailors come in with soggy uniforms from where a bucket dumped water on them.
And the engine room has reported smelling fish somewhere around the boilers.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like something fishy is going on.

Fields.DialogueText: Sounds like the engineers need to shower more thoroughly!

Fields.MenuText: We're at sea. People get wet.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I need to take it easier when the waves are up. It looks like we've been through a storm!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we need to rotate the mess hall cooks.

Fields.DialogueText: Do they need retraining? Condiments don't just swap themselves!
And let's not forget the sugar in the salt shaker.
What in the what now?
Erm. Awfully sweet potatoes at lunch, weren't they?
Captain...
Er... Oh! Morganas! Just in the nick of time.
Stations, then.
I think he's on to us...
@BATTLE
Oi! You helped too, ya Judas!
She was teaching me how to prank people.
So whose fault is it? Yours or the Belle's?

Fields.MenuText: You know how Manchester gets with pranks.
I claim full responsibility.
A little from column A, a little from column B.

Fields.DialogueText: You ain't takin' all the credit!
Mostly column B. Wait, which column's mine?
And it sounds like I succeeded!
... Heh. I suppose so. Just don't try anything on a scale like this again. It's getting out of hand.
I thought you'd be miffed like you usually are.
Well, it's nice to see it happen to someone else once in a while.
*ALARM*
Looks like that's taken care of. Just in time, too.
Wait, Lenny, don't go that way! There's still a--
... Bucket.
Remember when you thought he wasn't miffed?
Can't hear ya! Morganas ahoy!
@BATTLE
Hmm? What next lesson? Congratulations, you're a graduate!

Fields.MenuText: Not even an honorary diploma?

Fields.DialogueText: All right, that's that adventure. What's the next lesson in pranking?

Fields.MenuText: Another prank?
Somehow I knew there wasn't much to it.

Fields.DialogueText: I hadn't thought of that. Maybe in the future!
No, I'm serious! That's it!
Well, it's pranking! How much can there be?
Other than the lessons I taught ya, there isn't much to pranking. Just gotta be creative!
So... what now?
Now it's open season! You can prank whomever you want, just like me!
And that starts...
With that mild laxative in your coffee this morning.
I thought I'd eaten something that disagreed with me.
Hope you had fun in the head! I'll have some of my own fun with that Morgana over there...
@BATTLE
Mornin', Cap'n!
Manchester started pranking me again yesterday. Not only did she put laxatives in my coffee...
Captain, you look terrible.

Fields.MenuText: She did something to the hot water for my shower this morning.

Fields.DialogueText: Advantages of bein' a Belle! Little twitch of the finger and the heater cools right down.

Fields.MenuText: I was reading a report and the words just disappeared.

Fields.DialogueText: I told ya how to get it back! Invisible ink's easy enough to counter.

Fields.MenuText: She put another "Kick Me" sign on my back. At least the crew didn't join in.

Fields.DialogueText: Respect the classics!
Besides, it's all in good fun!
Morganas ahead, Cap'n!
*ALARM*
Speaking of good fun!
@BATTLE
What am I going to do with her?
How's that working out for you?
Ask her to stop, maybe?
Well, you're her captain.
It doesn't really matter, though. If only I could get back at her...
How about we prank her, then? Give her a taste of her own medicine.
You think it would work?
Does he think what would work?
Oh, uh...

Fields.MenuText: Napkins as bandages. We've got a bunch of the former and we're low on the latter.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, why di'n't ya say so in port? I can swing us back around!

Fields.MenuText: Training dolphins to attack Morgana vessels.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Cap'n, have you been in my Johnnie Walker?

Fields.MenuText: Tinkering with the training schedules. Some of the crew had concerns.

Fields.DialogueText: Glad to see that suggestion box getting some use.
*ALARM*
Hold that thought! We've got Morganas to whoop!
@BATTLE
O'Brien, did you get the string?
Lenny?
Miles of it.
Cooks are briefed and working.
Good. If all goes to plan, Manchester will finally get her comeuppance.
What's all this, then?
Oh, it's a surprise.
Oh? I like those! Can't wait to see what kind it is.

Fields.MenuText: You'll find out soon enough.
Let's just say you'll be head over heels for it.
A fun one. Count on it.

Fields.DialogueText: Ooh, sounds ominous!
Better be the newest pulps!
And if it ain't, I'll make it fun!
You get to the plannin', then, and I'll get to the fightin'! I spied a Morgana and I'm ready for a scrap!
@BATTLE
Hmm?
Could you come here for a moment?
Oh, there you are, Manchester.
Sure, no pro-- hey, wait a second!
Are you trying to prank me?
Whatever gives you that idea?
The fact that there's a string tied across this doorway, and I'm pretty sure I see a pie hidden round the corner.

Fields.MenuText: Uh... Aurora borealis?

Fields.DialogueText: Localised entirely within my corridor?
... Yes.

Fields.MenuText: I knew we should have gone with fishing line.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I would have used! You're learning from an expert.

Fields.MenuText: That's just for me for later. When I get hungry.

Fields.DialogueText: Looks like humble pie to me!
I told ya, I can't be pranked!
A likely story!
*ALARM*
Not to worry. You're a better captain than a prankster, I'll give ya-- Eep!
Manchester?
You wash off. I'll get everyone in place.
Oh, I'll get you in your place all right...
@BATTLE
You strung the bleedin' thing in the first place!
Because I was going to prank you!
How is it my fault that you tripped over a line you knew was there?

Fields.MenuText: It was freshly made, if it makes you feel better.

Fields.DialogueText: Honoured.

Fields.MenuText: You know, Lenny wanted me to drench you like you drenched him.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't mind a bit of soaking, but a pie to the face?

Fields.MenuText: Why is pranking suddenly off limits when it comes to you?

Fields.DialogueText: Because... cuz it is, that's why!
Look, I'm sorry. I won't do it again, all right?
... Awright.
Thank you, Manchester.
*ALARM*
Here. Take it out on some Morganas if you'd like.
Oh, they're gonna get it, all right...
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap'n?

Fields.MenuText: You all right, Manchester?
I hope this isn't the prelude to a revenge pranking.
Did you do something?

Fields.DialogueText: Kind of. Sort of.
No, it's not. Much as it'd be fittin' to do so.
Yeah, Cap'n. I'm all right.
I just wanted to say sorry for the other day. I... kinda blew up a bit and got miffed.
I've never been pranked before... I guess mostly because I've been the one doing all the pranking.
Bein' on the receivin' end, especially when I knew what was happenin'... Bit of a shock.
To be fair, I was bracing for it to be turned around on us.
It did make me think, though. About everyone I've messed with before.
I won't say I'll stop outright, but I think that toning things down wouldn't hurt.
And to be more receptive if I get pranked myself.
Does this mean you're a target now?
Heh. If you can get me again.
I'll take it as a challenge.
How about we challenge that Morgana over there in the meantime?
Sounds like a plan.
@BATTLE
Rather boring, that, eh?
Sometimes.
Seems like a quiet evening for once.
Say, Cap'n, you wanna do somethin'?
I feel like that's a loaded question. What kind of something?
Drinks!

Fields.MenuText: This had better not be setting up a rumor that we're an item.

Fields.DialogueText: You make it sound like that's a bad thing!

Fields.MenuText: What's the celebration?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you see...

Fields.MenuText: I'll pass. I need to keep my mind sharp.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on! Loosen up a bit!
Truth is, it's to make up for bein' hard on ya. What with the prankings and whatnot.
That's... rather nice of you.
And there's no funny business about it, I'll tell ya that for nothin'!
Just good ol' Johnnie Walker and my bessie!
Bessie?
Yeah! We're bessies! Or I'd like to think so, anyways.
You know... I think I agree.
Aw, that's brilliant! Come on, I'll get some glasses!
... Isn't that a Morgana on the horizon?
Always interruptin'! Let's glass her and get to toastin', bessie!
I'll drink to that!
